“Eblaite is a Semitic language embodying East and West Semitic features. Texts in the same language have been found at Mesopotamian sites such as Mari, Tell, Abu-Salabih and Kish. Eblaite is essentially a written lingua franca used by scribes, merchants and diplomats. It was not limited to Ebla, nor was it the spoken language of Ebla. Scribes, and some of their employers, could probably converse in it, but it is most unlikely that the scribes, merchants, diplomats or anyone else spoke Eblaite at home.”
